rules.natural: If the researcher has data analysis skill, then the researcher lacks access to computing resources.
Either the researcher has data analysis skill or the researcher's field work is successful.
Whenever the researcher monitors the forest area region, it follows that if the researcher analyzes environmental factors data then the researcher detects disease spread patterns.
Under the condition that the researcher tracks animal migration wildlife, then if the researcher analyzes environmental factors data, the researcher detects disease spread patterns.
If the researcher works in a national park, then the researcher monitors the forest area region.
The researcher works in a national park or collaborates with the local community.
Either the researcher receives government support or, if the researcher collaborates with the local community, then the researcher tracks animal migration wildlife.
The researcher has advanced equipment or it is not the case that the researcher receives government support.
If the researcher is affiliated with a university, then the researcher is part of a research network.
The researcher is either affiliated with a university or works for an NGO.
Provided that the researcher works for an NGO, then if the researcher's field work is not successful, the researcher communicates findings to the health organization.
If the researcher is part of a research network, then the researcher publishes results through peer review.

Under the condition that the researcher is located in a remote region, then if the researcher studies the outbreak disease, it follows that if the researcher has data analysis skill, the researcher does not lack access to computing resources.
Provided that the researcher uses satellite imagery technology, the researcher analyzes environmental factors data.
Either the researcher uses satellite imagery technology or the researcher's field work is successful.
If it is not the case that not being located in a remote region implies having adequate funding, then the researcher can travel to the research facility.
Whenever it is not the case that not being located in a remote region implies having adequate funding, then it follows that the researcher cannot travel to the research facility.
